Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dybowskin-2CDYa (Chensinin-1; UCLL1; Arg-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; BBL; more AMPs?)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretion,  the Chinese brown frog,Rana dybowskii; Rana chensinensis, China, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Strongly active against S. aureus ATCC12600 (MIC 6 uM) and E. coli ATCC11775 (MIC 3 uM).Toxicity: not hemo.lytic: hRBC: HC50 >300 uM. Additional peptides have been identified in the same species. Found in multiple species (FIMS). See also Shang et al. (2009) Zoo Sci 26, 220-226.Immune modulation: Chensinin-1 binds LPS with a possible use as an anti-endotoxin molecule (Dong W et al. 2015). Derivatives of this peptide reduced the expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines such as TNF-alpha (Dong et al., 2017). Updated 12/2015; 9/2020
Literature Information.Author: Jin LL, Li Q, Song SS, Feng K, Zhang DB, Wang QY, Chen YH2009
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol B Biochem Mol Biol. 2009 Oct;154(2):174-8
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of antimicrobial peptides isolated from the skin of the Chinese frog, Rana dybowskii.
